reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that data collection is declared and outlines the specifics of what data is collected.
reply.reference: The Noisy Brain App requires consent to its Privacy Policy and clearly states the data collection practices. URL: https://noisybrain.disciplemedia.com/privacy_policy

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal information such as name, email, phone number, IP address, and any other contact details or content voluntarily provided by the user.

content: other contact details or content provided by the user

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from specific details mentioned in the privacy policy regarding the types of data collected by the app.
reply.reference: Depending on how you choose to interact with us we may collect your name, email, phone number, IP address or any other contact details or content which you have provided to us. URL: https://noisybrain.disciplemedia.com/privacy_policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the user has the right to withdraw consent and opt out of data collection or request deletion of their data.

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: No, the app does not share data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app only shares personal information with declared data processors and does not sell, rent, or give away personal data to other third parties.
reply.reference: We will only share your personal information with our declared data processors. We may transfer your data to authorised data processors outside of the EEA...We will never sell, rent or give away your personal data to other third parties. reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with the following third parties: Disciple Media, MailChimp, Appsflyer, PubNub.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the third parties with whom data is shared.
reply.reference: Disciple Media, MailChimp, Appsflyer, PubNub. URL: https://noisybrain.disciplemedia.com/privacy_policy
